name: 1.1 - Check current drawings are used on site for works
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings
— all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, CEMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, CEMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS,
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The work area has been determined, and the extent of clear and grub has been reviewed by Fulton Hogan and the Superintendent. Any trees to be removed have been clearly marked and confirmed on site.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.2 - Joint Inspection to Mark vegetation or habitat to be removed and agree on locations for furniture e.g. bike hoop etc.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to removing any vegetation or habitat, the Contractor shall arrange an on-site inspection with the project team
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings CEMP Tree Management Plan 176.I1
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Trees shall be brought down in such manner as to avoid danger to personnel and traffic or damage to other trees, shrubs, structures or property outside the area being cleared or designated to be retained within the area being cleared
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any holes produced from grubbing operations have been backfilled with similar material and compacted
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Trees that are to be removed shall be mulched to the extent possible and the mulch retained for use in the Landscaping Works.
○ Noxious weeds shall not be mulched.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.7 - Dispose of concrete, bituminous and other recyclable materials.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Salvaged concrete, bituminous materials over 50mm and other recyclable materials have been sent to approved recycling establishments.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Clearing work shall not be undertake outside of the specified limits of work.

○ Tree branches extending over the carriageway shall be trimmed to provide a clearance of at least 6 m above the carriageway surface. Where whole branches are to be removed, the three cut method shall be used.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast materials have been inspected and fit for purpose and free of defects
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed Receival and Inspection Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast Reinforced Concrete Pipes shall comply with requirements of AS 4058
○ Pits deeper than 1.00m to be fitted with step irons as shown on the drawings. Step irons are compliant with AS4680 with a minimum average coating thickness equivalent to 600 g/m2.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.619 Cl. 701.04(a), Cl. 701.04(b)(i), Cl. 705.04(d), Cl. 705.11 AS4058 AS4680
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Receival & Inspection Checklist, Manufacturer cetificate or accreditation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Nominated material shall be free from perishable matter and conform with the requirements below:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Nominated material shall be free from perishable matter and conform with the requirements below:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cementituous grouts shall be minimum Type C class dual shinkage compensating, with a minimum 28 day compressive strength of 40 Mpa
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task. Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The position of all drainage lines are to be confirmed with the superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Horizontal clearance between the walls of trench to the side of pipe shall be 300mm – 600mm for pipes, and 0.5 to 1 times the overall height of the culvert for box culverts.
Trench walls to be vertical where practical Depth of trench:
○ > 100mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width < 1500 mm)
○ > 200mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width > 1500 mm)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Compacted to refusal using mechanical plant.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding material shall be compactied to no less than the below thickness:
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes & pits placed as shown on the drawings. No laying to occur until bedding lines and levels and compaction requirements have been satisfied
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Join pipes with rubber rings in accordance to manufacturer's instructions, check that the rings are clean and undisturbed. Any disturbed rings are to be cleaned and reassembled
2.8 - Place & compact backfill material over pipes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill under paved area: fill trench with selected back fill material to subgrade level
○ Backfill under area not paved: Back fill trench with selected back fill to a level 0.3 m above the top of pipe or culvert, and ordinary back fill above that level
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No repairs shall be undertaken without the superintendents approval of the repair materials and procedures
○ All repair procedures undertaken in accordance with Cl 701.25
3.1 - Compaction and moisture content of backfill & bedding material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill material shall be compactied to a mean density ratio of 92% using standard compactive effort.
○ Bedding material shall be compacted using a compaction plated to refusal.

1.5 - Confirm understanding of current CEMP and CHMP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All environmental measures and site controls to be implemented as per current CEMP and CHMP. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings CEMP CHMP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas where excavation will be made, all vegetation, refuse and obstructions shall be totally grubbed or grubbed to a depth of not less than 0.3 m below the subgrade and batters, whichever is the lesser treatment.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.201.05 ITP-001
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of material in accordance with Clause 204.04
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.204.04 Cl.204.06(c)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Placing fill shall not commence on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of rock subgrade shall be presented to the Superintendent for acceptance.
○ Details of any necessary amendments to the sub surface drainage design including trasverse subsurface drainage at the interfaces shall be submitted to the Superintendent for review.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Superintendent shall be notified where groundwater or seepage is encountered and the proposed action to be taken, shall be submitted for review. Any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for treatment and disposal of this groundwater shall also be submitted .
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where unsuitable material is encountered, actions shall be:
a) excavate the unsuitable material and backfill with 20mm Class 3 Crushed rock and compacted to min 98% Standard MDD to the approval of Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and set out activity. Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all Works meet level and location requirements. Verification of conformity with latest IFC drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Survey records & pegs on the ground
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: For areas where the subgrade height is less than one metre above cut height, the cut should be scarified to 150mm and recompacted with Type B material
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.04, Cl. 204.06
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proposed method reviewed, refer relevant ITP

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior excavation, Superintendent and Fulton Hogan responsible shall inspect each type of material encountered and, subject to verification by laboratory testing, agree on category of material in accordance with VicRoads Spec Section 204.04
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.04 Cl. 204.06(c)
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent agreement, Signed ITP
FREQUENCY: Each Lot (one day's production) prior to Commencing

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that the level at any point on the surface of the Cut Floor Level immediately below capping not differ by more than 5 mm above or 15 mm below the specified level. Level at any point of sugbrade shall not lie more than 20mm below a 3m straightedge in any direction excepting crowns. Water shall not pond at any point. The mean and standard deviation of the departures from the theoretical surface level within each lot shall meet the requirements of Table 204.031.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 204.03(f), Cl. 204.03(g) Table 204.031
FREQUENCY: Prior construction of the regulating layer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of rock subgrade shall be presented to the Superintendent for acceptance.
○ Any necessary amendments to the subsurface drainage design including transverse subsurface drainage at the interfaces shall be presented to Superintendent for review.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection/ Document Review
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent acceptance, Signed ITP
FREQUENCY: Each Lot (one day's production) prior to Commencing

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All pavement and verge areas at cut to fill zones shall be excavated to a minimum depth of 600mm below the cut floor level or top of the type B material, for a distance of not less than 15m into the cut and 30m under the fill from the cut-fill line at the upper surface of the Type B material.
3 - Testing for Compaction and Material Properties
FREQUENCY: Each Lot (one day's production), prior to Commencing Fill
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Test rolling of all fill layers and subgrade shall be in accordance with Section 173 and 204 of the VicRoads Standard Specification.
○ Fulton Hogan to provide not less than 24hrs notice to the Superintendent of the location and commencement time for test rolling. Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 173.03, Cl. 204.12
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Proof Rolling Register signed.
3.2 - Testing for Compaction and Material Properties
FREQUENCY: Testing as per table 204.141 of VicRoads Spec. for Roadworks and Bridgeworks
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Type B Material placed within 400 mm of top of Type B Material and Ripped and re-compacted material below Cut Floor Level= minimum compaction 99% MDD.
○ Type B material 400mm below the top of Type B material and Top 150mm of cuts= minimum compaction 97% MDD.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 173.04, Cl. 204.13, Cl. 204.14 Table 204.131, Table 204.141

The alignment and survey/level pegs will be indicated to the Contractor on the Site by the Superintendent prior to the commencement of work. No survey/level pegs to be removed by any persons until completion of works.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavation completed to required depth to allow placement of the bedding layer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All bedding material used shall be as follows:
— 75mm thick layer of 20mm Class 2 crushed rock bedding for median infill
— Bedding trimmed, moistened, and compacted as per Section 304
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall comply with the requirements of AS 3610
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforment used shall consist of SL62 mesh is to be placed with a minimum cover of 50mm from the top (unless shown otherwise on drawings).
○ Reinforcement must comply with the requirements of AS/NZS 4671.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check the deleivery of the batch is an approved concrete mix as ordered. VR330/32. Check for the time from plant to site,Check for the water qty added.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall be thoroughly compaction via contious tamping and internal vibration. Where concrete is unformed it shall be hand tamped to a smooth surface and screeded in accordance with the construction drawings.
○ Where fresh concrete is being placed against concrete which has taken initial set a properly formed construction joint must be used.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Batch location recorded on Load Batch Traceability Checklist
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Footpaths and other Surfacing shall be compelted with a wooden float.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that pram crossings are constructed in accordance with requirements for access and mobility.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Expansion joints shall be installated at 10m regular intervals using 15mm wide cork or bituminous imtergrate particle board.
○ Control joints at 2.5m regular intervals, 25% of pavement depth and 5mm wide
○ Prevent bonding between edging and surfacing. Either paint back of edging with bitumen or use a strip of bituminous felt material.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All concrete shall be protected from damage from early loading by pedestrians, animals, vehicles and from rain or any other cause.
○ Vehicles equal to or less than 1.5 tonnes in weight may be permitted to cross after 4 days, vehicles greater than 1.5 tonnes may be permitted to cross after 7 days.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
3.1 - Carry out sampling of concrete - strength and consistency
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sampling and testing of the strength of concrete shall be carried out in accordance with Clause 6.2 of AS 1379.
○ The consistency of the concrete shall be determined by a slump test of each concrete strength sample in accordance with AS 1012.3 and Clause 5.2 of AS 1379
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed/Test Records
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where matching in with existing surface levels, the new surface shall be within ± 5mm existing.
○ Section dimensions shall be constructed within the following tolerances:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

○ Granular filter material for bedding and backfill: Trench backfilled with no fines concrete filter medium complying with Cl 702.05

○ Pit Lids: Type M3 circular lid (as per SD 1051) for Type S1 pit
○ Flushout risers: constructed to the detail of SD 1631

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Filter material shall be moistened and compacted with minimal disturbance to pipes. The method of compaction shall be in accordance with the procedures and reviewed by the Superintendent.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Granular filter material placed and compacted compacted in layers not exceeding 300mm with minimal disturbance to pipes. Concrete is to be placed and compacted within one hour of mixing

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Installed in accordance with drawings and Cl 702.10

ITP-013 - Construction of Kerb and Channel
template name: ITP-013 - Construction of Kerb and Channel

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
— using the correct and complete set of drawings
— all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set out work in accordance with drawings. The superintendent will review and confirm set out. The alignment and survey/level pegs will be indicated to the Contractor on the Site by the Superintendent prior to the commencement of work. No survey/level pegs to be removed by any persons until completion of works.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If obstructing waterways, culverts or channels, temporary diversion of discharge of drainage and stormwater to be in place.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All bedding material shall conform with the requirements of sections 812 or 820 for crushed rock and crushed concrete respectively.
○ Unless otherwise stated, 20mm Class 3 or 4 bedding shall be used adn compacted to a thickness of not less than 100mm.
○ Bedding shall be trimmed to appropriate levels, moistened as necessary, and be firmly compacted.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding shall be moist but shall have no free water on the surface.
○ Concrete shall not be placed when the air temperature measured at the point of placement is >35°C or <5°C.
○ Temperature of concrete, measured immediately prior to placing, shall not be less than 10°C or greater than 32°C.
○ Concrete extrusion machines have minimum cement content of 320kg/m3.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete is to be fed to extrusion machine at a uniform rate. Concrete is to be satisfactorily compacted so that finished surfaces are free from surface pitting larger than 5mm diameter, honey combing or faulty patches
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Edgings: rendered to a thickness not exceeding 3mm and trowel finished.
○ Concrete to have a neat appearance and uniform colour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Transverse joints constructed at intervals not exceeding 2.5m.
○ Groove cut 20mm deep and > 5mm wide on exposed surfaces, with vertical cut made through the base of the groove (depth >50mm from surface of section).
○ Prevent bonding between surfacing and edging either paint with bitumen or use a strip of bitumen
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Not earlier than 3 days after casting.

○ Topsoil material free from perishable matter, lumps or balls of clay. Topsoil compacted behind the edging to a level of the top of the edging and to a width not less than 300mm unless otherwise specified.
○ Layers shall not exceed 150mm compacted depth
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
